alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND WEST CENTRAL HARDING COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 546 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Conchas Dam, or 23 miles southwest of Mosquero, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bell Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands
